results.title: Pretreatment of simvastatin on liver trace element levels during endotoxemia.
results.text_hl: In the @CHEMICAL_Lipopolysaccharides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008070 @@@LPS@@@, the hepatocyte cell structure was damaged. In the @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ + @CHEMICAL_Lipopolysaccharides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008070 @@@LPS@@@, hepatocyte, and sinusoidal @<m>DISEASE_Spinal_Cord_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013118 @@@cord damage@@@ were partially smaller than @CHEMICAL_Lipopolysaccharides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008070 @@@LPS@@@.

citations.NLM: Yorulmaz H, Ozkok E, Demir G, Ertugrul Yalcin I, Ates G, Olgac V, Tamer S. Pretreatment of simvastatin on liver trace element levels during endotoxemia. Arch Physiol Biochem. 2020 Jul;126(3):196-200. PMID: 30450988

results.title: Simvastatin protects ischemic spinal cord injury from cell death and cytotoxicity through decreasing oxidative stress: in vitro primary cultured rat spinal cord model under oxygen and glucose deprivation-reoxygenation conditions
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ effectively reduced @<m>DISEASE_Spinal_Cord_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013118 @@@spinal cord neuronal death@@@ and @DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@cytotoxicity@@@ against @DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@ischemia-reperfusion injury@@@, probably via modification of oxidative stress.

citations.NLM: Sohn HM, Hwang JY, Ryu JH, Kim J, Park S, Park JW, Han SH. Simvastatin protects ischemic spinal cord injury from cell death and cytotoxicity through decreasing oxidative stress: in vitro primary cultured rat spinal cord model under oxygen and glucose deprivation-reoxygenation conditions J Orthop Surg Res. 2017 Feb 27;12(1):36. PMID: 28241838
citations.BibTeX: @article{28241838, title={Simvastatin protects ischemic spinal cord injury from cell death and cytotoxicity through decreasing oxidative stress: in vitro primary cultured rat spinal cord model under oxygen and glucose deprivation-reoxygenation conditions}, author={Sohn HM and Hwang JY and Ryu JH and Kim J and Park S and Park JW and Han SH}, journal={J Orthop Surg Res}, volume={12}, number={1}, pages={36}}

results.title: Simvastatin inhibits neural cell apoptosis and promotes locomotor recovery via activation of Wnt/beta-catenin signaling pathway after spinal cord injury
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simv@@@ enhanced motor neuronal survival in the @<m>DISEASE_Spinal_Cord_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013118 @@@spinal cord@@@ anterior horn and decreased the lesion of @<m>DISEASE_Spinal_Cord_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013118 @@@spinal cord@@@ tissues after @DISEASE_Spinal_Cord_Injuries @DISEASE_MESH:D013119 @@@SCI@@@.

citations.NLM: Gao K, Shen Z, Yuan Y, Han D, Song C, Guo Y, Mei X. Simvastatin inhibits neural cell apoptosis and promotes locomotor recovery via activation of Wnt/beta-catenin signaling pathway after spinal cord injury J Neurochem. 2016 Jul;138(1):139-49. PMID: 26443048
citations.BibTeX: @article{26443048, title={Simvastatin inhibits neural cell apoptosis and promotes locomotor recovery via activation of Wnt/beta-catenin signaling pathway after spinal cord injury}, author={Gao K and Shen Z and Yuan Y and Han D and Song C and Guo Y and Mei X}, journal={J Neurochem}, volume={138}, number={1}, pages={139-49}}

results.title: Simvastatin mobilizes bone marrow stromal cells migrating to injured areas and promotes functional recovery after spinal cord injury in the rat.
results.text_hl: Immunofluorescence revealed that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ increased the number of GFP-positive cells in the @<m>DISEASE_Spinal_Cord_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013118 @@@injured spinal cord@@@, and the number of cells double positive for GFP/@GENE_RBFOX3 @GENE_287847 @@@NeuN@@@ or GFP/@GENE_GFAP @GENE_24387 @@@GFAP@@@ was larger in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treated group than the control group.

citations.NLM: Han X, Yang N, Cui Y, Xu Y, Dang G, Song C. Simvastatin mobilizes bone marrow stromal cells migrating to injured areas and promotes functional recovery after spinal cord injury in the rat. Neurosci Lett. 2012 Jul 19;521(2):136-41. PMID: 22683506
citations.BibTeX: @article{22683506, title={Simvastatin mobilizes bone marrow stromal cells migrating to injured areas and promotes functional recovery after spinal cord injury in the rat.}, author={Han X and Yang N and Cui Y and Xu Y and Dang G and Song C}, journal={Neurosci Lett}, volume={521}, number={2}, pages={136-41}}

results.title: Anti-inflammatory Therapy With Simvastatin Improves Neuroinflammation and CNS Function in a Mouse Model of Metachromatic Leukodystrophy.
results.text_hl: Treatment of the @DISEASE_Demyelinating_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D003711 @@@demyelinating@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ model with the nonsteroidal anti-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ drug @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ reduced @DISEASE_Neuroinflammatory_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D000090862 @@@neuroinflammation@@@, improved the swimming performance and ataxic gait, and retarded @DISEASE_Demyelinating_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D003711 @@@demyelination of@@@ the @<m>DISEASE_Spinal_Cord_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013118 @@@spinal cord@@@.

citations.NLM: Stein A, Stroobants S, Gieselmann V, D'Hooge R, Matzner U. Anti-inflammatory Therapy With Simvastatin Improves Neuroinflammation and CNS Function in a Mouse Model of Metachromatic Leukodystrophy. Mol Ther. 2015 Jul;23(7):1160-1168. PMID: 25896249
